title: Palliative Care Handbook Overview
summary: Comprehensive palliative care guidelines for healthcare professionals
author: OncoVista Team

content.text: Welcome to the OncoVista Palliative Care Handbook. This comprehensive resource provides evidence-based guidelines, practical tools, and clinical protocols for delivering high-quality palliative care across all healthcare settings.

content.title: Core Principle
content.content: Palliative care is appropriate at any stage of a serious illness and can be provided alongside curative treatments.

items: Fundamentals of Palliative Care - Core principles, definitions, and prognostication
Symptom Management - Pain, dyspnea, nausea, fatigue, and other common symptoms
Psychosocial Care - Emotional support, coping strategies, and spiritual care
Communication Skills - Breaking bad news, goals of care discussions, and family meetings
Care Coordination - Interdisciplinary teamwork and care transitions
Special Populations - Pediatric, geriatric, and cultural considerations

content.text: Use the navigation sidebar to explore specific topics. Each section contains practical guidelines, assessment tools, and treatment protocols to support clinical decision-making.

items: Pain Assessment Tools - Comprehensive pain evaluation methods
Goals of Care Discussions - Structured communication approaches
Dyspnea Management - Evidence-based interventions for breathlessness

content.title: Clinical Reminder
content.content: Early integration of palliative care has been shown to improve quality of life and may even extend survival in patients with serious illnesses.

items: Registered nurses and advanced practice nurses
Other healthcare professionals involved in palliative care

content.text: Each topic includes evidence-based recommendations, practical implementation tips, and relevant clinical considerations.
